plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A North American native wildflower that thrives in meadows and fields. Known for its bright yellow petals surrounding a distinctive dark brown cone-shaped center.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans are popular with pollinators like bees and butterflies, making them great for natural gardens.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: A cultivated flowering plant admired worldwide for its wide variety of flower shapes and colors. Blooms profusely in late summer to autumn.
plants.location: Cultivated gardens globally, native to Mexico and Central America
plants.funFact: Dahlias can produce flowers ranging from tiny pom-poms to massive dinner-plate sizes, making them very popular for ornamental use.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A classic autumn-blooming plant with complex, layered blooms often seen in floral displays and gardens, symbolizing longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures.
plants.location: Temperate climates worldwide, originally from East Asia
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are often used as natural insect repellents and have been cultivated for over 2,500 years.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree native to eastern Australia with striking orange to yellow spider-like flowers that bloom in late winter to spring and occasionally in early autumn in some climates.
plants.location: Eastern Australia and cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not a true oak, but its wood is often used like oak due to its strength and attractive grain.
